intro: Bilabrella disparilis, commonly known as the slender bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with a slightly serrated margin, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
